name: Narrator (Cloned)
ref_text: The mirror had been dormant for 11 years. In that time, the desert had tried to reclaim it. Sand scouring the titanium housing, dust settling in the calibration grooves like sediment in a fossil. The readings spiked without warning. Every instrument in the array screamed at once. And for three seconds that felt like 30, no one in the control room breathed.

name: Maya (Cloned)
ref_text: Oh my god, do you see this?

name: Elena (Cloned)
ref_text: This facility is now classified. No one enters or leaves without my authorization. If you have a problem with that, take it up with someone who outranks me. You won't find many. Congratulations. You've just made first contact with an alien intelligence, and your first instinct was to ask it for its email address. Humanity in a nutshell.

name: Chen (Cloned)
ref_text: So let me get this straight. We've detected an impossible signal from a star that shouldn't exist, and your plan is to recalibrate? That's like rearranging deck chairs on the Titanic, except the Titanic is the laws of physics. Maya, stop. Stop what you're doing right now. Look at the phase correlation. Do you see it? It's matching our transmission pattern. It's not echoing us, it's answering.

name: Raj (Cloned)
ref_text: This is, okay, this is insane. The frequency distribution follows a Fibonacci spiral. Nobody does that by accident. Nobody human does that at all. I'm not sure I should be the one running this. I mean, I've only been here six months and this is literally the most important data set in human history.

name: Kim (Cloned)
ref_text: Listen to me carefully. What you're about to see will change everything you think you know. I need you to stay calm and keep an open mind. You remind me of myself at your age. That terrifies me, honestly, because I remember what it cost.
